intro: Eliokarmos pilosus, commonly known as the hairy elokarmos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Eliokarmos pilosus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
